Prerequisite: Trained in Bluff and Diplomacy

Almost every scoundrel relies on their wit and their words to some extent, but you have refined them to a cutting edge. Your mouth is a sharper weapon than your sword, and you rely on it at least as much.

You might be a con artist, looking to earn your way in the world at the expense of others. You could be a diplomat, a spy, or a master of disguise. Or perhaps you developed these skills accidentally, discovering as you adventured that you preferred wars of wits to battles of blades.

SILVER-TONGUED SCOUNDREL PATH FEATURES

Deceptive Action (11th level)

When you spend an action point to take an extra action, you also gain combat advantage against one enemy you can see until the end of your next turn. In addition, you score a critical hit against this enemy on a natural roll of 18-20 until the end of your next turn.

Fast-Talker (11th level)

The first time you succeed on a Bluff or Diplomacy check in each encounter, one ally you can see gains a +5 power bonus to his or her next Bluff or Diplomacy check before the end of the encounter.

Deceptive Challenge (16th level)

You can roll a Bluff check or Diplomacy check in place of your standard initiative check.
